body_html:
I have tensorflow 1.5 and I tried passing this to the summary_writer on the nmt tutorial,
graph_def=sess.graph.as_graph_def(add_shapes=True)
It says - passing as_graph_def to summarywriter is deprecated, use sess.graph instead. However, sess.graph does not have add_shapes=True.

What is a good way to see what the tensors in the arrows represent. It is hard to dig through the code and figure the tensors and their shapes and map it to the corresponding graph

body:
I have tensorflow 1.5 and I tried passing this to the summary_writer on the nmt tutorial, 
graph_def=sess.graph.as_graph_def(add_shapes=True)
It says - passing as_graph_def to summarywriter is deprecated, use sess.graph instead. However, sess.graph does  not have add_shapes=True.

What is a good way to see what the tensors in the arrows represent. It is hard to dig through the code and figure the tensors and their shapes and map it to the corresponding graph
